forumNotes.author: wimb
forumNotes.content:
> Can someone point me to the right direction how to skip the all questions about selecting the installation partition and prefered format type (quick format or normal)?
The \[Unattended\] Section cannot be used when installing from hard disk like media.   
For OemPreinstall=Yes we have the following workaround to copy $OEM$ folder.  
Look at Q10 of FAQs [http://www.msfn.org/...Qs-t116766.html](http://www.msfn.org/board/FAQs-t116766.html "External link")  
ren_fold.cmd was changed such that $OEM$\\$1 and $OEM$\\$$ folders are copied  
as usual to systemdrive (usually C:\\) and systemroot (usually C:\\WINDOWS) respectively.  

Some other commands of the \[Unattended\] Section can be used from the \[Data\] section e.g.  

\[Data\]  
UnattendSwitch = "Yes"  
DriverSigningPolicy=Ignore  
NonDriverSigningPolicy=Ignore  

The remaining two questions in TXT-mode Setup on Select Install Drive and Format Type  
are **Essential** questions which gives the user control of what is going to occur.  
It is NOT advisable to skip these.

forumNotes.author: ilko
forumNotes.content:
> The \[Unattended\] Section cannot be used when installing from hard disk like media...
However, workaround is possible, not sure if you noticed it:  

[http://www.msfn.org/...UI-t120444.html](http://www.msfn.org/board/WinSetupFromUSB-with-GUI-t120444.html "External link")  
> Section UNATTENDED will be temporarily removed, only for the Text part of setup, and before start of GUI mode it will be merged back. PRESETUP.CMD is used for this purpose.
In details- while preparing source, remove \[unattended\] section from winnt.sif and place it in a temporary file. Upon start of GUI mode use presetup.cmd to merge the temp file with the unattended section, with $winnt$.inf, found in \\windows\\system32 folder. Same approach could be used to remove/amend other parameters, which may interfere with the Setup.
